sentences.english: He had laid out his legislative agenda for an autumn special session.
sentences.chinese: 他还重排了秋季议会的立法议程。

sentences.english: The government said the agenda will be set through existing working-level contacts.
sentences.chinese: 政府表示将通过工作层面的接触制定议程。

sentences.english: A published agenda, rigorously followed, is the easiest way to make nonattendance safe.
sentences.chinese: 有一份公开的议程，并严格执行，这是最简单的办法。

sentences.english: AMA staff prepares agenda materials for each CPT Editorial Panel meeting.
sentences.chinese: AMA成员准备每次CPT编委会会议的议程材料。

sentences.english: This is an ambitious agenda: But can it be done?
sentences.chinese: 这是一项雄心勃勃的议程，但它是否能够实现呢？

sentences.english: She was a woman with an agenda.
sentences.chinese: 她是一个有议程表的女人。

sentences.english: First we have the introductions and the agenda.
sentences.chinese: 首先我们进行介绍和议程安排。

sentences.english: The briskness with which he went through the agenda reflected his strategy.
sentences.chinese: 他完成议程如此的匆匆显示了他的策略。

sentences.english: Biofuels are near the top of development agenda in the country.
sentences.chinese: 生物燃料几乎处于该国发展议程的最顶端。

sentences.english: CIMA reserves the rights to adjust the agenda.
sentences.chinese: CIMA保有对议程进行调整的权利。

sentences.english: Software Description: About I-TRAC, This program helps plan, monitor and control management agendas .
sentences.chinese: TRAC这个程序帮助计划，监测和控制管理议程。

sentences.english: "Frankly, " says Kielburger, "human rights wasn’t on his agenda.
sentences.chinese: 柯伯格说“坦率的讲，人权并不在他的议程之内。

sentences.english: Ensuring workers and community safety is an important part of this agenda.
sentences.chinese: 保障工人和社区的安全是这一议程的一个重要方面。

sentences.english: They ran through the agenda at the beginning of the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 他们在会议开始时先浏览了一下议程安排。

sentences.english: The health implications of mitigation and adaptation policies should also be investigated.
sentences.chinese: 该议程认为，还应该研究缓解和适应政策的卫生意义。

sentences.english: The second part, the awarding ceremony of "Enlai Excellent Student Award".
sentences.chinese: 第二项议程，“恩来好少年”颁奖仪式。

definition: proposal/draft resolution/motion (to be debated)/to propose a bill/to make a proposal
general congress/meeting of the whole committee
to convene (a conference or meeting)/to convoke/to call together
consultative conference (political venue during early communist rule)/consultative meeting/deliberative assembly
